page.title: 14TRANSPORT (1)
page.content: This area is bounded by the B3047 to the north and the A31,which runs through the southern portion of the area. People living in this area have to make their way to a bus stop on either of these roads if they wish to catch a bus to either Winchester or Alresford/Alton. Along the B3047 there are 23 buses daily to Alton and 19 to Winchester. Along the A31 there are 10 buses to Winchester daily and the same number to Alton. It is also possible to catch a bus to Petersfield from the 'Percy Hobbs'. There are 7 buses daily to Petersfield and 8 in the opposite direction. NB The statistics given are Summer Timetable. Services are not so frequent in the Winter. Most people,however,have their own motor car, as buses are expensive in rural areas. (60 pence for three miles)
